hc.server.util

Class JavaLangSystemAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • hc.server.util.JavaLangSystemAgent

  • public class JavaLangSystemAgent
extends Object
    the HomeCenter provide build-in SecurityManager for HAR project.
    each JRuby code is based on reflection, malicious code can obtain system privileges through private field security of Class java.lang.System, so even if the System.currentTimeMillis() in JRuby will throws SecurityException about block memberAccess(reflection) by SecurityManager if JRE < 1.7.

    if JRE >= 1.7, the field security of java.lang.System is gone.

    so you can choose one of the following for your scripts (NOT code in jar) :
    1. to support all JRE version, replace java.lang.System with JavaLangSystemAgent in JRuby scripts (NOT java library).
    2. or upgrade JRE to 1.7
    3. or enable [permissions->memberAccess java.lang.System] to suppress the exception if JRE < 1.7.

    Important :
    if your project is developed or distributed before version 7.1 of HomeCenter, permission [memberAccess java.lang.System] is enabled default, otherwise is disabled.
    Since:
    7.1

      • lineSeparator

        public static final String lineSeparator()
        the agent method for System.lineSeparator.
        Returns:
        Returns the system-dependent line separator string. It always returns the same value - the initial value of the system property line.separator.

        On UNIX systems, it returns "\n"; on Microsoft Windows systems it returns "\r\n".

        Since:
        7.1
